marketNews.title: BEI Implements Revised FCA, Prepares to Release Short Sell
marketNews.content: BEI officially implemented the revision of the special monitoring board criteria for full call auction starting Friday (21/6). As previously discussed in Stockbit Snips, this criteria revision will tighten the provisions for a stock to be included in the FCA and provide flexibility for a stock to exit the FCA. In line with the implementation of this revision, 6 stocks have exited the special monitoring board as of Friday (21/6), one of which is Barito Renewables Energy ($BREN). Under the old provisions, BREN - which was subject to criterion number 10 in the special monitoring board - could only trade regularly after 30 calendar days since entering the special monitoring board on May 29, 2024. However, because the new criterion number 10 only requires a duration of 7 trading days for a stock to exit the special monitoring board, BREN's stock can now trade regularly and is no longer under full call auction. This revision was generally responded to positively by market participants, with stocks released from the special monitoring board unanimously strengthening in today's trading, except for those currently suspended. Besides the revision of the special monitoring board criteria, BEI is preparing to release the short sell trading mechanism, with an implementation target no later than October 2024. As of June 14, 2024, BEI has set 116 stocks that can be transacted with short sell, the full list of which can be viewed here. Short selling itself is a trading mechanism in the stock market where investors borrow shares from a broker and sell them in the market with the expectation that the stock price will fall. After the stock price drops, the investor buys back the shares at a lower price and returns them to the broker, thereby profiting from the difference between the selling price and the repurchase price. Key Takeaway: Generally, the revision of the full call auction special monitoring board criteria and the implementation of short sell potentially increase stock transaction liquidity. How broad investor access to the short sell feature will be depends on the final mechanism and terms and conditions provided by the exchange to its members. The mechanism and terms and conditions from the exchange will determine the extent of interest from exchange members in executing short sells.

tickerNews.title: Rumor CAMP is Targeted by Bahraini Investment Manager
tickerNews.content: DealStreetAsia reported that Bahrain-based investment manager, Investcorp, plans to buy a majority stake in Campina Ice Cream Industry from its controller, Sabana Prawirawidjaja. Sabana currently owns 83.94% of CAMP shares. There is no further detailed information regarding this transaction plan yet, while CAMP has not commented on this issue.

tickerNews.title: SSIA Recorded IDR 17.1B in Industrial Land Sales in 5M24, No Price Increase
tickerNews.content: Surya Semesta Internusa recorded industrial land sales of 121 hectares during 5M24, equivalent to 65.8% of the 2024 target of 184 hectares. Of this amount, 108 hectares came from Subang Smartpolitan, while the remainder came from Suryacipta City of Industry Karawang. Regarding land sale prices, SSIA noted that there was no increase in land prices in both industrial estates compared to 2023.

tickerNews.title: UNVR to Distribute Final Dividend of IDR 2.93 Trillion for 2023 Fiscal Year
tickerNews.content: Unilever Indonesia will distribute a final dividend for the 2023 fiscal year amounting to 2.93 trillion rupiah or 77 rupiah per share. The cum dividend date has not been announced, while payment will be no later than July 18, 2024. Referring to UNVR's share price on Friday (21/6) at 2,990 rupiah per share, the indicative final dividend yield is 2.6%. Previously, UNVR also distributed an interim dividend of 2.4 trillion rupiah or 63 rupiah per share in December 2023, so the total dividend for the 2023 fiscal year is equivalent to a 111.25% dividend payout ratio.

tickerNews.title: BREN Injects IDR 497.4 Billion Capital to Subsidiary BWE
tickerNews.content: Barito Renewable Energy announced that it has injected capital of 497.4 billion rupiah to its subsidiary, PT Barito Wind Energy (BWE), through the acquisition of all new shares. This fund has been used by BWE amounting to 29 million US dollars to repay Tranche B facility from Bank Negara Indonesia ($BBNI) on June 14, 2024. BWE itself is the owner of the Sidrap Geothermal Power Plant (PLTP) with a capacity of 75 MW. Previously, BWE completed the acquisition of the Sidrap Wind Power Plant (PLTB) worth 102.2 million US dollars with funding support from BBNI.

tickerNews.title: WINS Maintains 68% Fleet Utilization in 5M24, Revises Capex Upward to Anticipate Higher Demand
tickerNews.content: Wintermar Offshore Marine recorded a fleet utilization rate of 68% during 5M24, stable compared to the previous year. When compared to FY23, the average charter rate during 5M24 grew by +23.1% for high tier vessels and +14.5% for mid tier vessels. WINS also revised upward its 2024 capex allocation from 20 million US dollars to 35 million US dollars to anticipate higher demand along with increased offshore investment and limited vessel supply. From this allocation, WINS has realized capex amounting to 13.9 million US dollars.

tickerNews.title: BSDE Controller Increases Ownership Stake After Buying ~12.3 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: The controller of Bumi Serpong Damai, PT Paraga Artamida, purchased ~12.3 million BSDE shares at an average price of 943.36 rupiah per share on June 12, 2024. The total transaction value reached ~11.6 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, PT Paraga Artamida's ownership in BSDE increased from 40.1% to 40.15%.

tickerNews.title: Bappenas: 46% of Social Assistance Recipients Misaligned Due to Data Errors
tickerNews.content: The Head of the National Development Planning Agency (Bappenas), Suharso Monoarfa, stated that 46% of social assistance recipients were misaligned due to exclusion and inclusion errors. The impact is that undeserving people received social assistance, while poor households that should have received assistance did not receive it.

tickerNews.title: Luhut: Agreement Reached with Other Countries to Waive Export Duties on EV Battery Raw Materials to Secure Nickel Derivative Export Market
tickerNews.content: The Coordinating Minister for Maritime Affairs and Investment, Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan, stated that they have agreed with several other countries to waive export duties on electric vehicle battery raw materials. Luhut mentioned that this is done to secure the export market for nickel derivatives amid the current global trade protection trend.

tickerNews.title: Counterpoint Research: Southeast Asian EV Sales More Than Double YoY in 1Q24, Led by BYD and VinFast; Conventional Car Sales Down -7%
tickerNews.content: Research from Counterpoint Research found that electric vehicle sales in Southeast Asia more than doubled year-on-year in 1Q24, led by BYD and VinFast. Meanwhile, conventional car sales in Southeast Asia actually fell by -7% YoY in 1Q24.

tickerNews.title: China's Coal Production Down 3% YoY in 5M24, Imports Increased 13% YoY
tickerNews.content: China's coal production during 5M24 fell by 54 million tons (-3% YoY) to 1,858 million tons. Reuters reported that this production decrease occurred along with a situation of safer energy supply. Some of this production was replaced by cheaper imported coal, which was recorded to have increased by 23 million tons (+13% YoY) during 5M24.

tickerNews.title: KLBF's Subsidiary Partners with South Korea's GC Cell for Cell Therapy Business
tickerNews.content: Kalbe Farma ($KLBF) through its subsidiary, PT Bifarma Adiluhung, announced a partnership with South Korean biotechnology company, GC Cell, to develop the cell therapy business. This strategic partnership aims to facilitate the entry of Immuncell-LC into Indonesia. Immuncell-LC itself is a cell therapy innovation for liver cancer surgery. Furthermore, this collaboration also includes technology transfer and collaboration in developing the scientific proof Natural Killer (NK) Cells therapy pipeline capable of killing cancer cells.

tickerNews.title: KAEF Plans to Close 5 of 10 Plants in the Next 5 Years Due to Efficiency Needs
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Kimia Farma ($KAEF), David Utama, stated that the company plans to close 5 out of 10 plants owned by the company within the next 5 years. David mentioned that this decision is based on efficiency needs, considering the company's financial health condition is not yet adequate and the utilization of the plants is not optimal as maximum utilization only reaches 40%.

tickerNews.title: US Government Asks EU to Delay Anti-Deforestation Law Enforcement
tickerNews.content: Reuters reported that the US government has asked the European Union to postpone the anti-deforestation regulation because US exporters are having difficulty meeting the regulatory requirements. The anti-deforestation regulation is scheduled to take effect on December 30, 2024, and will require exporters to provide proof that their supply chains do not contribute to forest destruction. Previously, this regulation received strong rejection from Indonesia, Malaysia, and Brazil, who considered that the rule would hinder trade and create additional costs for their products.
